text.title: part4_Antje Duvekot on life as a folk singer, her family and her music

hi.s: DS : What is a new goal ?

text.p:
AD :
Balance .
Trying to grow my career enough to make sure it does n’t consume me .
It ’s hard to balance a touring career because there is no structure to your life .
I ’m trying to take this dream and make it work as a job .

hi.s: DS : How challenging is it to obtain that in the folk world ?

text.p:
AD :
There ’s not a lot of money in the folk world .
In generally right now I think people ’s numbers are down and only a few people can make a living at it .
It ’s pretty competitive .
I ’m doing okay , but there ’s no huge riches in it so I ’m trying to think of my future and maintain a balance in it .

hi.s: DS : Do you think of doing something less folk-oriented to give your career a push ?

p.s: Not really , I ’ve done that a little bit by trying to approach the major labels , but that was when the major labels were dying so I came in at a bad time for that .
I found that when it comes to do it yourself , the folk world is the best place to make money because as soon as you go major you are paying a band .

text.p:
AD :
More money , more investing .
It ’s a hard question .

hi.s: DS : What things did you encounter doing a studio album that you had not foreseen ?

text.p:
AD :
Giving up control is hard when you have a producer .
His vision , sometimes , is something you ca n’t understand and have to trust sometimes .
See how it comes out .
That was hard for me , because up until now I have been such a do it yourself , writing my own songs , recording them myself .

hi.s: DS : What is your most treasured possession ?

text.p:
AD :
I ’d like to say my guitar , but I ’m still looking for a good one .
I have this little latex glove . [ Laughs ]
It ’s a long story —

AD :
When I was in college I had a romantic friend named David , he was kind of my first love .
We were young and found this latex glove in a parking lot .
We though , “ Oh , this is a nice glove , we ’ll name him Duncan . ”

hi.s: DS : You found a latex glove in a parking lot and you decided to take it ?

text.p:
AD :
Yeah [
Laughs
] .
He became the symbol of our friendship .
He ’s disgusting at this point , he ’s falling apart .
But David and I are still friends and we ’ll pass him back and forth to each other every three years or so when we ’ve forgotten his existence .
David surprised me at a show in Philly .
He gave Duncan to the sound man who brought it back stage , and now I have Duncan .
So he ’s kind of special to me .
